page.title: 04Church of St. Mary's.
page.content: An ancient building consisting of chancel,nave and embattled tower with pinnacles and pre_Reformation bell,the chancel arch and south doorway are Norman.The church seats 90 people,all} furnishings are oak carved by Thompson of Kilburn with his inscription of a mouse.The church was founded by the de Lacey's of Pontefract in the 13th century and gained Royal patronage via Duchy of Lancaster,it is now in the diocese of Sheffield with priest in charge from Barnby Dun it is to be re-appointed in 1985 to a new larger parish centered on Fishlake.The stained glass windows show many royal coats of arms,the font is Saxon,shield of Knights Templar to be seen on tower.Services are held every Sunday morning,a beautiful well loved place of worship,a focus of village life.{
